title: Sex and Gender in African American Communities
description: Gender and sexuality issues that influence the social, political, economic and cultural development of African-America. Special attention given to how racism affects the realization of standard gender conventions within black communities, as well as to myths of black sexuality, black feminism, and queer politics. 4 lectures. Fulfills USCP.
prerequisites: Completion of a course in GE Area D1 or D3
